measures.title: Adult Binge Drinking - Number
measures.description: Estimated number of adults who report binge drinking in the past month (men having 5 or more drinks on one occasion, women having 4 or more drinks on one occasion in the past month). This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the household population of adults 18 years of age and older who reside in the City of Chicago.
measures.source: Chicago Department of Public Health, Healthy Chicago Survey

measures.title: Adult Binge Drinking - Rate
measures.description: Estimated number of adults who report binge drinking in the past month (men having 5 or more drinks on one occasion, women having 4 or more drinks on one occasion in the past month) divided by the estimated number of adults, expressed as a percent. This percent is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the household population of adults 18 years of age and older who reside in the City of Chicago.
measures.source: Chicago Department of Public Health, Healthy Chicago Survey

measures.title: Accidents - Number
measures.description: Number of people who died due to an unintentional injury (ICD-10 codes: V01-X59,Y85-Y86)
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Division of Vital Records, Death Certificate Data Files

measures.title: Accidents - Rate
measures.description: Age-adjusted rate of people who died due to an unintentional injury per 100,000 population
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Division of Vital Records, Death Certificate Data Files; US Census Bureau, 2010 and 2000 Census; Intercensal years (2001-2009) estimated through linear interpolation by the Office of Epidemiology, Chicago Department of Public Health; For 2011-2014, 2010 Census population was used.

measures.title: Active transportation - Number

measures.title: Active transportation - Rate

measures.title: Adult Overall Health Status - Number

measures.title: Child Obesity - Rate
measures.description: Percentage of Chicago Public School students with valid data elements on the Illinois Child Health Examination form whose BMI is equal to or greater than the 95th percentile on the CDC BMI-for-age growth charts (for either girls or boys) adjusted for non-response through logistic regression
measures.source: Chicago Public Schools IMPACT SIM, a web-based student information management system operated and maintained by CPS.

measures.title: Child Opportunity Index - Number
measures.description: The Child Opportunity Index (COI) consists of 19 indicators combined into three component indices: Economic, Health and Environment, and Education. The component indices are then combined into a composite index and the city is divided into quintiles with index scores assigned to levels Very Low, Low, Moderate, High, Very High.
measures.source: diversitydatakids.org (Brandeis University) and the Kirwan Institute for the Study of Race and Ethnicity (Ohio State University)

measures.title: Adult Diabetes - Number
measures.description: Estimated number of adults (18 years and older) who reported that a doctor, nurse or other health professional has diagnosed them with diabetes (excludes pre-diabetes or diabetes only during pregnancy). This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the household population of adults 18 years of age and older who reside in the City of Chicago. Data from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System was collected and weighted using a different methodology than the Healthy Chicago Survey. Caution should be used when interpreting trends.
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (2000-2009); Chicago Department of Public Health, Healthy Chicago Survey (2014-2016)

measures.title: Adult Diabetes - Rate
measures.description: Estimated number of adults (18 years and older) who reported that a doctor, nurse or other health professional has diagnosed them with diabetes (excludes pre-diabetes or diabetes only during pregnancy) divided by the estimated number of adults, expressed as a percent. This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the household population of adults 18 years of age and older who reside in the City of Chicago. Data from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System was collected and weighted using a different methodology than the Healthy Chicago Survey. Caution should be used when interpreting trends.
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (2000-2009); Chicago Department of Public Health, Healthy Chicago Survey (2014-2016)

measures.title: Economic Hardship - Number
measures.description: Hardship Score is calculated using the following six social and economic indicators: (1) Dependency - Percent of population under or over 64 years of age. (2) Crowded Housing - Percent of occupied housing with more than one person per room. (3) Poverty - Percent of people living below federal poverty line. (4) Per Capita Income. (5) Unemployment - Percent of people in labor force over 16 years of age that are unemployed. (6) No High School Diploma - Percent of people over 25 years of age without high school diploma. For each of the six indicators at the community area level/zip code, values are standardized. A sum of the standardized values comprises the Hardship Score at the community area/zip code level.
measures.source: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey 2015 5-year estimates and 2010 5-year estimates

measures.title: Income Inequality - Rate
measures.description: Uses the Gini-Simpson formula to measure how economically diverse a population is by calculating the probability that two people picked at random will be from a different household income category: less than $35,000, $35,000-$99,999 or $100,000 and greater. Coding changes for 2010: SEER site recode ICD-O-3/WHO 2008 is used for cases diagnosed 2010 and later, based on ICD-O-3 updated for Hematopoietic codes based on WHO Classification of Tumours of Haematopoietic and Lymphoid Tissues (2008).
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Illinois Cancer Registry

measures.title: Life Expectancy - Number
measures.description: Two years' of data were combined to allow for small area calculations. Abridged life tables were calculated for 1989-1990, 1999-2000, 2009-2010, 2010-2011, 2011-2012, 2012-2013 and 2013-2014. For simplicity, we refer to these years as 1990, 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, and 2014 but it should be noted that all analyses are based on two-year averages centered on January 1 of the second of these years. Where age-specific death counts equaled zero, 0.5 was substituted to allow for stable calculations. Life expectancy was calculated using the Chiang Methodology, using age-specific death rates for ages 0-1, 1-4, 5-9, and in subsequent 5-year age groups to age 85, with an open-ended interval beginning at age 85.
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Death Certificate Files 1989-2014; US Census 1990, 2000, 2010

measures.title: School Attendance — Rate
measures.description: The sum of the number of days in which students were marked present. A student may be marked as follows for each day: 1. Present for 300 minutes: 1.0 in the numerator; 2. Present for a 150 to 299 minutes: 0.5 in the numerator;3. Present for homebound instruction: 0.5 in the numerator;4. Present for 0 to 149 minutes(includes all absence reasons): 0 in the numerator divided by the sum of the number of days that students were“ in membership” at the school.Students are considered to be in membership if: 1. The student is enrolled in the school; 2. School is in session that day; and 3. The student is scheduled to attend school that day

measures.title: Number of Serious traffic crash injuries (excluding highways) in Chicago- Number
measures.description: Number of people who died or sustained an incapacitating injury due to traffic crashes in Chicago (excluding highways) regardless of address of residence. It includes severe lacerations, broken limbs, skull or chest injuries, and abdominal injuries.

measures.description: Estimated number of CPS high school students who report being physically active for 60+ minutes for 7 of the past 7 days divided by the estimated number of high school students, expressed as a percent. This percent is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth smoking - Number
measures.description: Estimated number of Chicago Public Schools (CPS) high school students who report smoking cigarettes on one or more of the past 30 days. This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth smoking - Rate
measures.description: Estimated number of CPS high school students who report smoking cigarettes on one or more of the past 30 days divided by the estimated number of high school students, expressed as a percent. This percent is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth soda consumption - Number
measures.description: Estimated number of Chicago Public Schools (CPS) high school students who report consuming one or more servings of soda or pop daily for the past 7 days. This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth soda consumption - Rate
measures.description: Estimated number of CPS high school students who report consuming one or more servings of soda or pop daily for the past 7 days divided by the estimated number of high school students, expressed as a percent. This percent is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth suicide attempts - Number

This number is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.
measures.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Survey

measures.title: Youth suicide attempts - Rate

This percent is weighted to represent the population from which the sample was drawn, the enrolled student body of CPS high school students.

measures.title: Per capita income - Number
measures.description: Per capita income is the mean income computed for every man, woman, and child in a particular group including those living in group quarters. It is derived by dividing the aggregate inflation adjusted income of a particular group by the total population in that group. This measure is rounded to the nearest whole dollar. (https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/meta/long_INC910215.htm)
measures.source: UUS Census Bureau:  American Community Survey 2010  5-year estimates , 2015  5-year estimates, 2010-2015 1-year estimates for Chicago

measures.title: Early and adequate prenatal care - Number
measures.description: Number of births where the mother received adequate prenatal care by the Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization Index (APNCU). The APNCU uses two elements obtained from the birth certificate-when prenatal care began and the number of prenatal visits from when prenatal care began until delivery. The final APNCU measure combines these two dimensions into a single summary score. Adequate prenatal care is defined as a score of 80% or greater.
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Vital Statistics

measures.title: Early and adequate prenatal care - Rate
measures.description: Percentage of births where mother received adequate prenatal care by the Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization Index (APNCU) among all births
measures.source: Illinois Department of Public Health, Vital Statistics

measures.title: Cancer Incidence - Number
